Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sim K
Reviews.Content: For the price offered, it a decent hotel, we stayed for 2 night here. It quite a distance walk to ladies market and mongkok MRT station , but bus stop is just a walk down the slope. there is a supermarket just a 5 minute walk away on argle street. The bed is comfortable though typically hong kong the view out the windows is just another building. there is two school nearby so could be a bit noisy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: Delenna
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at Anne Black YWCA in Hong Kong. The staff was nice and helpfull. The room was decent sized for a single traveller. The room and batroom looked clean. The elevators were small so I'm glad I didn't have to use then on busy hours. I didn't spend much time in my room but when I did, I liked it. The noise from the streets wasn't too heavy so I had a good nights sleep. There's a decent sized closet in the room, near the bed (in case someone is wondering from my photos). The bathroom was on my right hand side when entering (again, if you wonder about the photos). The taxis are really cheap to a "westerner" so the location is good, wherever you want to go :) Good value for your money! (I booked and paid via Ebookers, no hassle there either)

Reviews.Title: “Need refurbishment urgently!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: This time, I stayed in HK for two weeks and stayed both in 2 five-star hotels and Anne Black. This was my 3rd stay and the rooms that came with bathroom were again sold out so I had to stay on the ladies floor with common bathroom again. This time, I didn't like it as much though the price couldn't be beat (HKD390). The air-con was so noisy and loud that I had to use two pillows to cover my face in order to fall asleep. The Front Desk staff told me that they were considering renovation. To be honest, the location is good and the neighbourhood is decent. If they upgrade their rooms, I will definitely return even if it means paying more... The ladies floor is safe though. I notice that most guests are family groups with children. The Front Desk staff are all very friendly and helpful. That's why I am still giving this hotel a rating of 3!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: nettleandfern
Reviews.Content: Anne Black is a good value for money accommodation. Its a slight walk from the nearest metro station. It has a decent restaurant on the basement but no room service. rooms are a little small but very clean and decent.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and decent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: zee_sg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anne Black for 5 days. Im quite satisfied with the cleanliness of the room and service of the hotel staff. I was given a room w/o a bathroom, and so had to use the communal bathroom. That was okay too, because the bathroom was clean, and it was never really occupied when I needed to use it. However there is no fridge in the room.. I couldnt chill my food and beverages. It takes about 15mins to walk to Mongkok MTR. The guest house is situated right smack in the middle of a residential estate and school - it felt pretty safe even when I walked back to the guest house during night time. Generally, this place is no frills, good for budget travellers. I'd only stay here if Im on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Value Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: PrinterBird
Reviews.Content: The Anne Black YWCA is not a pretty hotel but it certainly works as a cheap place to stay when you are looking to control your budget. The rooms are clean and they and the bathroom facilities are cleaned daily which is really my main concern with a room. The beds are hard and not the most comfortable but work just great after long days roaming the strees of Hong Kong. We found the hotel to be quiet and fairly easy to get to via the train (about a ten minute walk from Mong Kok station) although you won't find it convenient to stop back at the hotel to change or drop off bags (its just far enough out of the way of other things to do). Would certainly stay here again as it was perfectly pleasant and pretty much what we expected for our money. Restaurant had some OK breakfasts for a reasonable price so it made starting the day easy.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in HKG”
Reviews.Author: guideme
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of our HKG and Shenzhen package tour. It is located in the Mongkok area, however it's quite a long walk to the shopping area, so we take a cab (HKD 20-23) to the Mongkok shopping center like Langham Place and Night market areas. The rooms are quite small and old however its clean and we had our own bathroom. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is that its a 5 minute walk to the main road. It's located in a school and residential area. I do like the restaurant in the lobby during lunch, good and very affordable food if you choose their lunch specials, at night they provide live music. They have free wifi in the restaurant and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money for this rate”
Reviews.Author: joecheong
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I stay at the YWCA for 4 nights last week with my family.I book 2 rooms cos i have 2 teenage kids with me and we end up having a separate room in different floor.Request for room to change to the same floor for the family was not done.Room wise we found one of the room my children stay have some weird smell and the electric kettle at our room actually have stain in it and smell of milk.Location wise is not really great as it is uphill and inconvenience if it rains.The elderly will have a hard time walking back to the hotel if there is rain and they are not prepared with umbrella.I would recommend spending a little bit more for the Metropark Kowloon hotel which is just across the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Your Budget”
Reviews.Author: Allegrah
Reviews.Content: Went there a few days ago. The nearest station is Yau Ma Tei. I'd say the walk from hotel to the station is around 15 minutes. The way to the entrance is an uphill but manageable. The landmark is the gasoline station in the corner of waterloo and another road. The room is very clean and simple. They have very good room service. There's wifi at the lobby but there's none in the rooms. But anyway, it doesn't matter so much since I just went there to sleep after a long day of tour. I stayed for 3 nights and they charged me 2,100 HKD plus 200 HKD deposit which they will return when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Valueable stay if on budget..”
Reviews.Author: pearl_lynely
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong with a mission to visit Victoria Peak, Disneyland, Ngong Ping and Ocean Park. I chose Anne Black as it was known to be close to MTR (Yau Ma Tei station). The price is reasonable for a stay in HONG KONG, and i was very fortunate to get a very clean room. Since i didnt stay in my room that much, it was fine with me. Their service is satisfactory too.. But i think i'll stay somewhere else in future..

Reviews.Title: “Very simple but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Harry C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anne Black as a budget single traveller for one week. The hotel is located within a ten minute walk of Yau Ma Tei MTR. The single room had a bed, old style box TV with mainly chinese channels (i.e no ESPN sport !), aircon and small bathroom. The staff were very pleasant and the restaurant (athough slightly pricier than the local canteen style restaurants on Waterloo Road) gave a decent meal at a relatively cheap price (I paid HK$450 a night for the room with no breakfast). A good deal of younger travellers but little noise or commotion after 11pm. If you are simply looking for a place to rest at the end of the day and otherwise explore HK this place is a very good location and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Price is right... That's about it”
Reviews.Author: Sens4life
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Mongkok, the rooms are very basic and bathrooms are communal. Air con settings can't be changed and does little to change the room temperature. Beds are typical Chinese stiff mattresses. To my surprise there was a TV but nothing worth watching. Wi-fi only works in the lobby. Three MTR stations are within walking distance, and if you need to get to/from the airport the hotel partners with Vigor Transportation to get you there for $110, not much more than the Airport Express. Even though it sucks it's the only place I can afford outside of Chunking Mansion, so I'll probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ELHV
Reviews.Content: My review is abit late, but I stayed at this hotel in late Oct 11 for four nights. The hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to get to the subway. The room was small, but no big deal. There was a shared washroom and it was always clean. The staff was considerate and helpful. After staying here, I now always look online for YM/YWCAs to stay at. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I returned for the second time and it's better this time!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at Anne Black, I paid HK$900 a night and was disappointed by the blood-stained mattress and poor condition of the room interior. This time, I paid HK$440 for the weekend stay and had absolutely no expectation at all. And this time...it was worth the money. I was on the ladies' floor with the bathrooms outside along the corridor. I tried rooms like this once in NYC and was curious how it would be like for HK. As it turned out, it was quite fine. The room was surprisingly cleaner than the ensuite room I stayed in last time. There were two beds (no frills) with a 1970-model TV but it was quite clean. The common bathrooms were clean too. Safety wise, guests were given two keys - one for the room and the other for the bathroom. Other guests can still come up to the ladies' floor though... Overall, for what I paid for, it's fine. The hotel is very fine from the MTR though, it takes 20 mins to walk to the Yaumatei station. A taxi ride will take just 2 mins and costs HK$20. By the way, given the surge of tourists from China, hotel room rates have soared. This is especially true of the weekend rate. I moved out of the Silka Seaview on Friday because their room rate doubled for the weekend. At Anne Black, I paid HK$440.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: oohlalalala
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for almost two weeks. Was a 10 minute walk to Mong Kok MTR or $HKD20 taxi ride if you don't want to walk at night; lots of places to stop for breakfast along the way (Soy Street in particular). Rooms and bathrooms were fine, beds were comfortable, and staff were polite and friendly. There is free wifi in the lobby which was handy. Noise wasn't an issue for me, doors can tend to slam loudly but they never woke me up. You'll find lots of different people here, students, families, adults etc. There's a basketball court just down the road in front of the public library for anyone looking to keep active while away - I jogged around the block a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Low-cost Basic Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sthl0001
Reviews.Content: One should not expect luxury, but it would provide a quiet, clean room for your stay. It is in a very good location. After learning one's way, it takes only ten minutes to walk to the Mong Kok pedestrian shopping area. Two single beds in a room. I rented a unit w/o a bath. It is a little bit cold in the communal bath room as it is not insulated (in January). There's only a small tray to hold your stuff in the bath stall. You need to bring your own slippers. Other than that everything else is fine.

Reviews.Title: “planning to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: cherrylimli
Reviews.Content: after review these comments, will booking this hotel for this Hong Kong trip..

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation for those planning to explore”
Reviews.Author: Kurtbob
Reviews.Content: If you want cheap place to stay and you don't mind a twenty minute walk to Nathan road, this is good hotel. The rooms are small, as should be expected, and toilets and showers are down the hallway guesthouse style. While the airport express shuttle does not stop at this hotel, it does stop at another five minutes away making transportation to and from the airport a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Linen,Safe Clean Room, Interesting Location-very good value budget stay.”
Reviews.Author: Missminerva
Reviews.Content: Situated in Mong-Kok (means "busy place" and it is !) in Kowloon, the Anne Black is located to make everything you want to see and do easily accessible by bus, metro or taxi. The famous and fascinating streets and markets are within walking distance as is the beautiful Kowloon park. The Public Transport in Hong Kong is very good, cheap and efficient and all the stops and street names are written in English as well as the local language. I quickly learned how to get around using an Oyster smart card. Buy one at Metro station for 150 HK dollars and then use it for all public transport, including the trams and wonderful Star Ferry to HK Island and getting around is very easy. I found all the staff at Anne Black very polite, helpful, efficient and professional and they spoke English well. This made my time there much easier and enjoyable than I thought it could or would be.The single room was simple, but no complaints, it had a kettle, own loo and shower and a tv. I was on the 19th floor with a sparkling night-view of the lights, skyscrapers and noisy, busy streets below, thank goodness for the lift! One thing I appreciated very much was the spotless housekeeping. Beautiful clean linen, room serviced every day and cleaned - as good as a top class hotel and much better cleanliness than some! No residents kitchen to use but the Restaurant is good with efficient table service. There are so many great places to eat so close, I only ate there once. Overall, Anne Black YWCA was a good place for me to stay for three weeks in Hong Kong and I would be happy to return and book again. Happy Chinese New Year to all at Anne Black!!

Reviews.Title: “Expect what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: Samson C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights over Christmas and New Years. I am giving this property a 5 star rating not because it is a "5 star hotel" but rather it was good value for your money. It is a budget hotel and if you expect anything more you will be disappointed. We had a family of four with two young kids so we were able to put the twin beds together and managed to squeeze together. The beds were somewhat hard but after a long day out it really did not make a difference in having a good nights sleep. Overall the cosmetics of the room and hotel in general shows signs of aging and wear and tear. However you can tell the efforts are there to keep the rooms clean and tidy. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood with a lot of schools so in general found the area pretty safe. Every night we come into the lobby I think it is the night manager he stands right in the lobby to greet you which I also think is a security measure. I've also noticed him patrolling the halls periodically. The restaurant below is adequate though you don't have to walk far to get to the many other dining options available. The only downside which may be important to some people are there is no Internet in the rooms and the closest MTR station is still a good 10 minute away. If Internet access is important as it was for me and didn't want to make the trek to the lobby each time, I just got myself a prepaid SIM for my IPhone for $198HK which pretty much gave me unlimited data for my 10 day stay. Otherwise you can just go down to the lobby area to use the wifi they have there for free. Since we had a family of four sharing a cab the cost was pretty close to taking the MTR anyways. Cabs were plenty and easy to catch outside the hotel. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Anne Black YWCA - Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: super_fast_eddie
Reviews.Content: This is more like a hostel than a hotel, I have to stay there only for a night before heading back to the airport and the only room available was with shared bath facilities, The front desk and the cleaning staffs were professional. The rooms are old and need major renovation, the shared bathroom also needs upgrade. The bed was comfortable and I had a good sleep. The location is OK, it takes probably 15 to 20 minutes to the nearest MTR station. It is right in the middle of the residential area and it was relatively quite. They have airport shuttle buses every hour for appr. HK$230; if you have two people, you might as well take a cab which is appr. HK$260

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK - a great budget deal IMHO !”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_1711
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 5 nights during Thanksgiving week in November and on our first visit to Hong Kong while en route to Beijing. I didn't expect anything more than a hostel, but we were pleasantly surprised - it is indeed a Guesthouse with some Hotel amenities. The Anne Black Guesthouse is situated in a dated skyscraper on a busy intersection of Waterloo road. The entrance is around the corner and up a steep hill, across the basketball court (or as a short-cut on the escalators located in the library building that you pass). It's an easy and pleasant 15-min walk from Mongkok Station - even with luggage - and recognizable from afar. The lobby looks like there was an attempt to give it somewhat of a modern appeal - in contrast to the building itself - is small but well suited for a Guesthouse and void of any frills. The elevators are small, but adequate. The room was dated, spartan with twin beds, a sink, small closet, small desk and a TV on top of a small fridge - and clean, with crisp white linens. On the desk a tray with water-cooker, tea, instant-coffee etc. which we used frequently. (But only after having overcome the initial shock over the "coffee" offered, us coming from the "Latte-Capital" of the world ;) I felt really lucky with our room located on the quiet side of the building and not facing noisy Waterloo Road. The bathroom across the hallway was absolutely bare, no frills whatsoever, no outlet for your grooming tools - the only amenity was a small mirror - But it was clean and everything functioned. The staff are helpful, pleasant and efficient. No problem with WiFi, available in the lobby and adjacent restaurant only. The Guesthouse, including the restaurant - and in particular the lobby - can be a "zoo", as it seems to be the preferred accommodations and assembly point for droves of young teenagers from neighboring countries on their school excursions. The adjacent restaurant is apparently a local favorite, dated, a bit shabbily decorated in a true "Elvis" theme - LOL- and of course well equipped for karaoke, if one should desire so and throw a party ! It is fun and perfectly safe to roam the area at day/night and find great places to eat all the wonderful offerings of local Chinese cuisine. Conclusion: As far as I can tell a pretty good deal for a Hong Kong budget-stay in a prime location - glad I took the opportunity and surely will be back here for another stay in this wonderful city ! Thumbs up and wholeheartedly recommended (if you're not too picky) !

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Hostel”
Reviews.Author: SuppersReady
Reviews.Content: The hostel is located about 15-20 minutes walk from Mongkok KCR station so probably the best way to get there is to take the Airport Express to Kowloon and then the K5 hotel shuttle bus to the Metropark Hotel in Waterloo Road. It's about 5 minutes walk from there. If you're on a very tight budget and all you want is a bed in a clean room (albeit one that looks dirty because of the age of the building) with very basic facilities in a reasonably central location then this may be a viable option. There is a self-service laundry, the restaurant is OK (but there are better close by) and they will charge HKD30 for 30 minutes internet use. However, it's not a hotel. Don't expect any comfort whatsoever. Also, our experience was that it was very noisy as it's a hostel that accommodates visiting youth groups and we were continually disturbed late at night and early in the morning by the comings and goings of not particularly considerate fellow guests. Next time, I'll pay more and stay in a proper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Tchumb
Reviews.Content: Good location with bus close by to Star Terminal and lots of excellent public transport and taxis. Easy city to get about and this YWCA takes singles, couples, men and women- one floor women only I think. Very reasonable prices for HK. No frills but very clean, good functional en-suite with plenty soap etc. Ground floor restaurant provided basic but adequate breakfast and other meals (mostly frequented by locals I think - a bit like a club). On both visits I've arrived by pre-arranged bus from airport at reasonable charge- takes about 1 hour - not much longer than a taxi. Hotel can arrange this bus - also to take you back to main airport when you leave. There are other options but I've found this bus very reliable and good value for money. Leaves from basement of airport- can be hard to find- but I've always asked and found people really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but clean & adequate.”
Reviews.Author: dancerdeb1
Reviews.Content: It reminds me of an older hospital ward. It's very spartan, & the elevator is seriously overworked & SLOW, & there's no internet in the room. However, there is free internet in the restaurant & lobby area, but it is turned off at night when the restaurant closes! I don't like that it's located up a hill, it's a bit of a workout, & quite a walk to the MTR. The staff was very nice, & I liked the self-serve laundry as well. All in all, for the price you can't beat it. It's the best deal in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves a 3.5 - Good budget hostel”
Reviews.Author: Wai888
Reviews.Content: + Positives Very reasonable price compared to like hostels. The rooms are clean, fair sized and their room service is thorough and on time. Air conditioner is powerful albeit slightly on the noisy side at maximum setting Convenient walking distance to Mongkok (where many shops and market places are located) Live entertainment and restaurant next to lobby area - Negatives I got a room which was overlooking the very busy Waterloo Road and next to the communal showers and toilets. The problem was the noise of the traffic during morning rush hour and the sound of the water pipes which ran through my room during the night. No WiFi in the rooms. Have to go down to lobby area. Advice Ask for a room that is NOT overlooking Waterloo Road and next to the shared shower and toilets. Bottom line Basic 'all you need' and no nonsense hostel situated in a prime location with reasonable customer service. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old furnitures but clean room”
Reviews.Author: milkasue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 20/10/2011 to 22/10/2011 for 2 nights after our 3 nights stay in Rambler Oasis Hotel in Tsing Yi. The hotel room looks old but is spacious and clean. Location is good, in the city area, but takes about 15 min walk to the nearest MTR station. Internet access is not available in the room, but is FOC in the lobby. Taxi (RED) from this hotel to the airport is around HKD180. Pros: Clean and spacious. Cons: Old furniture, quite far to the nearest MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: gazndaz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 6 nights at the Anne Black in September 2011. It was exactly what we wanted. We had a twin room with private bathroom. It was basic and clean. The room had a very good fridge, adequate TV, desk, storage and comfy beds. The linen and towels were regularly changed and the room was cleaned every day. There was plenty of hot water all the time. The A/C worked well. (and it was very hot whilst we were in HK - 34 degrees every day). The little cafe was fine although we never ate there only had drinks, but it was always fairly busy. The reception had good free WiFi. It appeared to be a safe place (and area) for a single female traveller. It is a little out of the way, perhaps, for people who don't know HK very well (this was visit 10 for us) but it was convenient for the MTR (especially for trips into the New Territories) - about 15 minutes stroll in the very hot weather, 10 minutes walk if the weather had been cooler! The price of the accommodation was very reasonable for HK and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “YWCA Anne Black”
Reviews.Author: jillsabs
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to try a hotel with a shared bathroom and I was honestly apprehensive how that would turn out. Thankfully, the bathrooms were cleaned daily and were well-maintained. In the 4N3D that we were there, I only encountered another guest once inside the bathroom. The hostel is about 2 kilometers away from Nathan Road and the nearest MTR station. Rooms are clean but a little old and musty, there are sinks inside the room so you can do your basic cleaning without leaving your room. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller15
Reviews.Content: It's a basic hotel. Ours has a full bath, 2 twin beds, a desk, AC and a small TV. The room was old, but clean. It worth the price. The beds are very firm. If your need is a place to sleep, this is the hotel for you. It is not easy to find an unoccupied taxis around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Anne Black Hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: starfirebhs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for approximately 3 weeks in September 2011. Initially, I stayed in the ensuite room and later moved to the shared bathroom. For the money, I think the shared is best. If u do decide to have an ensuite room, please remember to take ur own shower curtain. I forgot to bring mine (even after reading reviews) and there was a messy puddle each morning. Shower curtains are hard to find and by the time I did find one, I had already moved to the other room on another floor. Staff are friendly, but elevators are small and slow. For me, however it was not a problem as I was gone for most of the day. This was my second stay at this hotel and would stay again. The hotel also provides transportation to the airport for 110 HKD or roughly 14 USD. The hotel is clean as is the bathroom and the restaurant food was decent. The blinds are raggedy and internet is expensive. I do not have wifi. Use the internet at the Chungking Mansion instead. They also have laundry services on the 6th floor for 20 HKD each wash and dry and an iron. Bring ur own soap since theirs is built into the washing machine and woefully inadequate. I also liked the adjoining book room, but no bibles are available. Bring ur own. I did not like not having a refridgerator in the room. Last year I did have one. Buy an Octopus card and take bus 7 to Nathan Road. There are restaurants and a 7/11 close by the hotel so you can buy ur own water, tea and instant coffee. Bring shower shoes and make ur own coffee and tea with the kettle provided. The staff cleans daily and leave toothbrushes, shower caps and soap. Towels are large and clean. Also, the area is very safe and the rooms with shared bathrooms are large by Hong Kong standards. It is fun to eat the warm egg tarts from the nearby bakery for breakfast. I also sampled the jellyfish with seaweed, glutinous rice in lotus leaves, sushi and other stuff bought from the nearby supermarket in front of the bus stop to get to Nathan Road (bus #7).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pupuli
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it had alot to do with our great hotel, Pousada De Mong-Ha, in Macau but this one was a real let-down. Our room was a 'Superior' with a King-sized bed but it turned out to be two twin-beds pushed together so inevitable either my wife or myself would end up on the crack between the bed which made it quite uncomfortable. They provided bare-minimum necessity with the room. Water-heater but no coffee, tea....The whole set-up reminded me of a real budget-type B/B or pension house. The staff members were professional and helpful but seemed impersonal. It also must cater heavily to group tours for we had two large and noisy groups check in two different nights and I finally had to call front desk in one of the nights after 11PM because one group, college age, was exceptionally loud and acting like they were on school playground. We really wanted to move to another hotel but it was booked online and pre-paid for entire stay so we were stuck with it. One good thing was the location which was near, 10- to 15- minute walk, to the Mong Kok MTR station and the Lady's market along with countless eateries. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Budget...”
Reviews.Author: PropesorTuko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with shared T&B.. I had some apprehensions about staying in a room with shared T&B but after I stayed in Anne Black's, my opinion changed.. The size of their room is right for the price we paid. It's the cheapest for such kind of accommodation... We enjoyed our stay and we're sure, we're gonna stay in Anne Black everytime we travel to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Anne Black best Hotel in Hong Kong for budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: kencarabba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Anne Black Guest House from June 24th until July 18th. I visited my GirlFriend Fiona(best woman in the world). When I arrived the staff was friendly but they never seem to smile. But this seemed to be very common when I was in HK. I stayed in room 1119 and 1109. The rooms were very clean. The bed is a bit hard but nothing to worry about. There is a television in the room that offers 5 stations where 2 of them are English. The rooms have AC that worked very well. The bathrooms are shared but they are very very clean. Make sure you bring slippers. Towels, shampoo, and soap are provided. WIFI Internet is free but there were times it did not work. The WIFI does not work in the rooms. You have to go to the lobby to get online. If you want to get online for free, go to the library. The library is to the left of the hotel. There is a restaurant on the lobby floor. The restaurant had very good food. The hotel is located in a safe area. Alot of foreigners stayed in the hotel when I was there. The hotel is close to Waterloo Road, which offers plenty of buses to get you to anywhere in HK. I used the buses alot. They are very inexpensive. I have read alot of the reviews on this site about Anne Black Guest House and I was surprised that some visitors gave this hotel a bad rating. I was very happy with my stay at Anne Black. Its not a perfect hotel. But if you are looking to stay at a place that is affordable, clean, and safe. Go to Anne Black. The Anne Black Hotel is the best you can buy in Hong Kong for the price they charge you. Do not go to Hostels in HK. They offer you practically nothing and they are not safe. Almost all the hostels in HK that I researched are very small and they usually do not give you what they claim to have. Me and my GirlFriend went online to search for Hostels in Hong Kong. We found a few that we liked so we decided to go look at them. We thought we found some great Hostels for great prices. But when we went to the Hostels to look at the rooms, we were shocked to see that the pictures of the rooms that the Hostels said they were renting were not even close to being what the room actually was. Every Hostel that me and my Girlfriend visited did not offer a room that was worth staying. Once again, DO NOT STAY AT HOSTELS unless you have absolutely no other options. There is a church service on Sunday morning at Anne Black on the lobby floor. The church is OK but not great! If you are a Christian and you want to get a good message then go to the church service at Anne Black on Sunday morning at 10am. If you want to go to a really great church then go to the ICA Church on Hong Kong Island. I hope this was helpful. If anyone wants to ask me more about the Anne Black Guest House or if you have any questions about Hong Kong. Feel free to contact me at my email and I will be happy to tell you whatever you want to know about Hong Kong or about the Anne Black Guest House. KenCarabba68@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: sarebear007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days, it was a budget hotel, the room was big enough for the 3 adults staying. The room had a tv and the bathroom was sufficient, this hotel is perfect if you plan on exploring the city most of the day and only come back for rest and sleeping! The hotel only gave one pillow per bed so if you prefer more then you will need to bring your own :) Reception staff were incredibly helpful and patient especially during typhoon warning when we had no idea what was going on. Be reminded that it is helpful to have the hotel card with you at all times or at least the hotel name in Chinese characters with you to show taxi drivers, it is a little bit of a walk- maybe 15 minutes to the train station. Breakfast is ok, but there is bakeries and McDonalds near by if you prefer something a little like home. Hotel is walking distance to markets and the train to Shenzen! Given the roads are very busy most rooms are high up so you don't get any noise Only negative is the lifts take forever but if you are only using them twice a day you'll be fine :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: A decent and clean hotel, located a bit off the beaten track on Kowloon Island, but still easily accessible (about 10 to 15 minutes walk from the subway). Rooms are okay, a bit tired but clean. The beds are pretty hard -as is quite usual in Asia- and rather small - with my 6'5 I didn't fit on it :)

Reviews.Title: “A cheap place to stay, but rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: timetohangupmyboots
Reviews.Content: By Hongkong standards, this is a good place to stay - some disadvantages, some advantages - probably the most important among the latter being the low cost. Mistake # 1... I took teh airport express shuttle which dropped me at the hotel close to the YWCA. Bad idea - the hostel is located on an upward slope on a road hidden behind buildings. It took me 15 minutes of asking and poking to find the path. (Despite being able to SEE the building!) Finally, I called the hostel and they told me to come via the public librarry (there are no signboard anywhere en route) - nut comfortable when you are lugging around the luggage. So my suggestion - pay 50 Hkg dollars and take a cab fromt eh airport express Kowlooon. Check in was quick, the otel is not exactly bright and sprightly, neither dull. Staff is polite as would be expected in a YWCA, there are always some community services happening on the lower floors so tehre are always peopel around. The room itself was very small - me and my 2 bags could just about fit in. (I took the larger room costing 450 dollars). Now this IS the best you will get in Hkg for 450 dollars. Rooms are clean (Best part - they have huge windows), air con. The TV has 6 channels (1 English - the rest are Cantonese / Mandarin). There is a hot ware kettle (remember to bring your own tea / coffee). The restaurant is really good - large, inexpensive, quick service, good food. Taxis are easy to get, and while the hostel is located in the midst of residences, a public library and schools, it is 5 minutes walk from the main Waterloo road. The MTR is a good 15 minute trek, through the busy streets of Mongkok. I just wish rooms had wifi - they do not. So, to use internet, you need to go to the reception (always full of people, no place to sit) or the restaurant. It is free though (unlike hotels that always charge for the net) All in all, the YWCA Anne Black is a good place for single people on a budget, but if you can afford bigger bucks, or are here with your family, stay at a hotel with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Option Near Night Mark”
Reviews.Author: olegnatadero
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because we wanted an affordable choice in the kowloon area. the room was very decent and very clean, the staff were perfectly friendly and even accommodated our request for late checkout. the hotel is very near the metropark hotel, which is served by the airport express shuttle buses (k5) - a convenient way to travel from the airport and back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: varun_vikram
Reviews.Content: The location is good .Located in Kowloon near to may shopping areas and night markets . The train station is also walkable . Being a lodge the toilets/bath rooms are common .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Inoffensive”
Reviews.Author: TessHock
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Anne Black for three nights, and were perfectly happy with the service, location and rooms. Stayed on the women's only floor (which was unexpected, but fine) and found the bathrooms clean, with good pressure in the showers. We never had to wait or even encountered anybody else in the shared bathrooms. Our room was characterless, but tidy and had a kettle, basin, complementary soap, toothbrush and towels, as well as extra pillows. Beds were very firm, but comfortable enough, and we weren't ever too cold. Service was friendly, with the receptionists helping us out with buses, trainlines and directions. We were a little taken aback by how expensive the use of the computer and internet services was, but it wasn't a terrible problem for us. Not as close to a subway station as would be ideal, but considering we were out and about all day, it didn't worry us too badly. Also got a few giggles out of Man Fuk Road. All in all, a fairly good hostel, that we had no problem with - just nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY OVERRATED !!”
Reviews.Author: jatin_Desai
Reviews.Content: when i was planning to go to HONGKONG with my girlfriend for a small trip, i was looking for some economical accomadation. many people suggested me this place, and i had read farily good reviews about this place on tripadvisor. but I was thoroughly disappointed. the rooms are'nt so cheap either. when i booked the rooms by email, they asked me for 400 HKD with credit card. i assumed they had same prices for 2 people or one person (since all hotels in HONKONG have same tariff for 1 person or 2 person). but when i reached there with my wife , they told me I had to pay an extra 200 HKD as I had an extra person with me !! I was like "what !!! you must be kiddin !! " if I knew about that earlier, I am pretty sure I would have got a better deal with other good hotels in TST , like THE GUANGDONG hotel. its pretty far away from MTR, which I hate !! its rooms are not hotel rooms at all, but hostel rooms !! dingly small with hard bed, small windows !! frankly speaking its highly overrated !!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: ChenZhiwei
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel that i has even stay. When we check-in, the staff at help desk is not friendly and showing attitude. The bed at the room are hard as rock. After staying for four day, I has stiff neck and backache. During our visit the temperature is 14 ~20C but the window can not keep the coldness away. The worst part is that the hotel only provide thin sheet of blanket instead of comforter. The air con is the dinosaur type that did not come with remote control. We have to step on our bed to set the air con temperature and fan. In turn of internet, it only available at the ground floor. The hotel has two small and slow lift. One of the lift operate even floor while the other operate odd floor. Thus getting to the room might take a long time. The location of the hotel is average. You need to walk about 15 min from Yau Ma Tei MTR station or 20 min from Mong Kok. Even thou it is slightly cheaper, it not worth to stay there. It feel like a hostel more then a hotel. For couple or family trip, it better to avoid this hotel as it will likely spoil the holiday mood.

Reviews.Title: “first choice if you are on budget!”
Reviews.Author: bari_ttc
Reviews.Content: YWCA located on a small hill, although it is in a quiet area, it is far from the closest metro station. Price is 'cheap' compare to other hongkong hotel. Room is quite clean and simply. YWCA is suitable for on-budget traveller, cheap price and clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: candi2008
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic hotel , at a reasonable price and with helpful staff. We liked the location in Mong Kok because it's an interesting neighbourhood, full of locals. (I highly recommend joining in the tai chi in the little park beside the hotel.) It wouldn't suit everyone because it's quite a distance from the main tourist area down near the waterfront, so it's not the kind of place where you would pop back to regularly during the day. But if you like to get out and about most of the day, it's fine since the bus/metro are close by. The airport bus drops you at Yaumatei metro stop at the corner of Nathan and Waterloo and it's not a long walk from there to the hotel. We had a twin room with bathroom and it had all the basics we needed (incl a small frig and electric jug). The beds are very "firm", but this is fairly standard in HK/China. There were major problems with the bathroom on our first day - both the shower and toilet overflowed and we had a couple of inches of water (?!) on the bathroom floor! We told the reception staff and then left to go sightseeing a bit apprehensive about what we might find on our return, but by the time we got back everything had been cleaned and we had no further problems. . The attached dining room is not worth using - poor service and selection and quite expensive. We stayed 3 nights here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Blood Stained mattress, noisy facing, cold room - terrible!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: I have never given a one-star for any hotels I reviewed on TA but this one deserves it. First of all, I booked 3 nights with this hotel and paid HK$880 for one night because it was Christmas (just last week). Their usual pricing is half of that, if I am not wrong. You will therefore need to take the daily rate I paid into consideration when reading this review. The windows are not sound proof, they are the ones you have at home. With our room facing the busy street (we can see Metropark Kowloon from our windows), we were sleepless. The fire station is not far away either. Furthermore, the windows couldn't keep the cold away when temperature plunged down to 9 degrees C the night we checked in. We were literally shivering cause we were only given a thin blanket, not a comforter. Regardless of price though, there's something quite unforgivable about this hotel - we were on the floor unpacking our bags when we noticed a blood stain on the edge of the mattress. We tried to call the Front Desk but they were NOT on duty after 11 p.m, I think. Anyway, no one picked up. When I confronted the staff about the mattress in the morning they didn't even argue with me and agreed to us checking out early. When we were there, I didn't see any individual travelers. There were only group tours from China. All in all, this hotel is not worth your while unless you have a very very tight budget, am travelling solo and pay only HK$400-500 per night!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Anne black YWCA value for money.”
Reviews.Author: cherrywitfang
Reviews.Content: This is my forth time returning to stay at YWCA, I am a big fan of this hotel and its locations, I alway prefer to stay in Mong Kok side, this hotel is perfect, as I love the shopping in that area all with in short walking distance. Its only a 10mins walk to Mong Kok train station and Ladies market+ other great shopping in that area, it great value for $ considering other hotels in HK in the same area would have smaller rooms. (for the same price if not more) Always clean and comfortable, daily room tidy-up. They recently had a facelift, and room decor have been renew. Hall way still old fashion, its a older building and the lifts are small. They have old fashion lock on doors, we only had one key between the two of us. Frienly staff, they are use to having an array of internationl guests and can help you with maps and infomations/what you need to know to get around. Just one note- they take $200 Hk as a deposit for mini bar when you check in. There is circle K and 7-11 right down the road. Cafes, breadshop, atm. Easy to walk down the ladies market for supper at night, heaps of outdoor hawker stalls. Hotel is on a uphill slope. If you really don't like the walk (eg if you visit HK in the heat of summer.....), from Mong Kok stain station a taxi fare to hotel is only $18-24 HK. We were just there in Nov and thankgod for aircon, because its a warm Nov. Our rooms aircon was great. We stay at level 18 this time, no noise at all. If you need quiet you may want to ask to be move to upper floors. Our friend stay at delux room 19th floor, a little bigger then our startard twin. There is no power plug in bathroom which is a bit annoying. Ideal for travellers looking for safe, clean decent stay!

Reviews.Title: “cheap but terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Evie1121
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative if other hotels are booked and this is the only last resort available. What made this experience bad was 1) the smoking from other guest on our floor. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel but some guests didn't care. 2) bring your own hair dryer. There is only 1 hair dryer at this hotel and it is shared between every guest that stay here. Prepare for the hike up the hill towards the hotel. Their dining area is very cheap but be prepared for the nearby students who will dine at this location during lunch time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chicabeingme
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about staying at the YWCA Anne Black at first as I had never really stayed in such accommodation but it turned out to be really great. The room, though small, were cozy and had all necessary amenities. An electric tea/coffee maker, TV (which played only Chinese shows), reading lamps and 24X7 hot water. The bathrooms were really clean. The beds were very comfortable. The view from the window was quite nice as our room was facing the street. The staff was very courteous and friendly. They even helped translate a Chinese document. And after checking out, we cud leave our bags with the hotel and shop around and pick up the bags just before leaving for the airport. Also, a plus point for shopaholics, the hotel is just about 15 mins walk from the ladies market ! So we went thr at least once every day ! There is a 7eleven right across the street to buy anything. ATMs as well. Also the MTR station is just a few blocks away. I would recommend this place for budget stays. It was very well worth the price and we had a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Fair accomodation for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman-nl
Reviews.Content: Very simple rooms with just 2 beds + a wash basin. Batrooms on the corridor. Location is realtively good, in a nice area close to public transport. Nice reception area with sittes + pretty good in house restaurant. Simple but value for money (we paid Eu 40 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Very basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Raga_queen
Reviews.Content: Cheaper that most of Hong Kong, but no luxuries. Old fashioned! Noisy - next to main road and very noisy guests. Staff was OK.

Reviews.Title: “almost a bagpacker's hotel”
Reviews.Author: sportsjunkie
Reviews.Content: very basic hotel. clean but really old. HIGHLIGHT OF MY STAY: they charged me hk$30 for 1 hour of internet! and I had to go to their business center, bring my own laptop & hook-up. worse, they didnt have an adaptor available in the room so i had to go to my room & get one. that's the most stimulating experience i had in an otherwise boring stay in the hotel. will i be back? i don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Budget rooms”
Reviews.Author: MatrixHiTech
Reviews.Content: Very tiny room. Very good and low price. Hard bed. Up hill walk to hotel. Hotel in Ho Man Tin area which is out of the way in Hong Kong transportation system. You can take the #7 bus (almost any bus going west bound on the Waterloo Road bus stops), 3 stops to the Fire Station stop, and the Yau Ma Tat MTR station is there. You can take the MTR to almost anywhere in Hong Kong. However, you can easily walk to Mongkok where are all the shops and restaurants. By the way, there no long YMCA hotel nearby on Waterloo Road in Kowloon anymore. That hotel now becomes City View commercial hotel at much higher in prices.

Reviews.Title: “the budget to suit your needs if you're out most of the time.”
Reviews.Author: Trmia
Reviews.Content: Since this trip was at the expense of my company, so I did not expect the best enjoyable accomodation. But if you're looking for a budget hotel and if you're out most of the time, then this maybe what you're looking for. Firstly this guesthouse, is a really old one. The elevators do not stop at every level, its specifically for the odd & even floors. I must say the rooms are indeed kept clean, but the beds are like wooden planks. I've got not much to say, since the location isn't that fantastic either. But since I travelled around mostly by cabs, it doesnt make a difference if I were to take the MTR. And the service, oh well....

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: yuyashiina
Reviews.Content: The place may be a little far from the city but if you want to get easy access in their market, quiet environment and get off with the city living this is a place to go to. they also have a restaurant that offer good food at reasonable price. Clean rooms, nice people. We even had a chance to try their videoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Black”
Reviews.Author: TradeMeSeller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a week and a half at the Kimberley Hotel - The Kimberley was great as well but we needed a change of scenery. This hotel is located nearby an international school. It was crazy fun. My god the first day we checked in we were told of a hotel safety check to happen the following day - we were booked into a room on the 15th floor and had to high tail it down 15 flights - hahaha that was fun. You see I am not the most smallest of women at 5ft 10 without shoes on and being a westerner and polynesian NZ Maori - you get the idea. The staff were great - although I think they thought we were a little nuts - we went shopping everyday as you do in Hong Kong and would come back to the hotel laden with bags and bags of goodies. The room was very clean and cool. The TV channels were brilliant - no need for highend cable. They have internet room which is cheap to use and the hotel itself is very very safe as the Manager was strict about visitors. The bedding is very spic and span. The restaurant is wonderful - both indoor and an outside food bar with fresh cooked food while you wait. The waiters are brilliant and will have you laughing your heads off. the food is delicious and very cheap in comparison to New Zealand - I couldnt believe it - . A wonderful place for backpackers -its very inexpensive. We met some great people from all over the world but the nicest were the locals and the workers from the hotel. Highly recommended especially if you are travelling alone and female. The staff will keep an eye out for you but you must hail cabs from outside the hotel or call them from your room - . A great stay and lots of fun. Definitely recommend and I'll be heading back there in 2011/2012. It is a no frills hotel but very well run and extraordinary staff of cleaners, waiters, guides. A note about the taxi cabs in HK - they are dirt cheap - for the cost of a cab to take you half way round Hong Kong and back is the same price as driving 4KM in an NZ cab. HK is beautiful - you will love it. Liked it so much we stayed the last leg of our trip there instead of going to the Marriott such was the quality of hired help.

Reviews.Title: “The Anne Black - YWCA: Great location and nice price”
Reviews.Author: jh6056
Reviews.Content: Interesting little gem, sandwiched in Kowloon fairly close to local shops and amneties such as local parks and library to use free net. I caught the airport bus straight here and right back to the airport after a few days. The staff were very attentive and curteous, And the free breaki in the lounge/bar, which included a few non-residents, and included karioki a few nights of the week, The room was clean, spacious(for hong kong), included a tv, air con, ensuite, I have no complaints and would return..

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zsuska
Reviews.Content: Do not expect luxury. It is a budget hotel. Location is acceptable, MTR station is 10 minute-walk. Rooms are old, but clean and has fridge. Bed was very hard!Overall not bad, but i think there is better places in HK.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: LauriKaljuvee
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 7 nights on the last floor in single room. Bed is indeed like a concrete, but i lake hard beds anyway (it is good for back muscles). I usually ate the breakfast in the hotel cafeteria, was OK for the price (around 30 HKD). Distance to the Yaumatei MTR is about 1km (for me it took 15minutes). There are a ton of eating places with only local people and with very good vibe. Of course, the noise during the night is quite strong (when compared to the suburbs of Tallinn, Estonia) and they use some kind of strange cleaning liquid (bad smell sometimes). Hotel staff was very friendly. I recommend this hotel for anybody who is on the tight budget and likes to walk every day at least 10km.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PennyW26
Reviews.Content: The Anne Black was the first stop on my around-the-world trip and I instantly felt safe. I'd booked a single room but somehow ended up with a twin on the 17th floor which was a bonus! In terms of friendly reception service, there's not a whole lot of that but the staff were reasonably helpful when required. I've read about bed bugs at this hotel but I didn't have that problem and found the hotel to be extremely clean. Sure it could use a lick of paint and the brown blankets aren't inviting, but if you're on a budget, it's definitely worth spending your money here. It's about a 10 minute walk to the MTR and Nathan Rd and is a bit noisy, but I guess you'll get that everywhere in Hong Kong. I booked this hotel through Agoda and got it for about HK$300, whereas they will charge you HK$440 if you book through them. It's definitely worth shopping around for a better price at this hotel. They will also try to charge you HK$40 for half an hour to use their internet, so head next door to the library where they have free internet on the ground, sixth and seventh levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Hong Kong, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: xocliwtb
Reviews.Content: The Anne Black is about a 20 minute walk from three different MTR stations, including Mong Kok where there is all sorts of shopping on Sai Yeung Choi St S and the other markets. The rooms are pretty simple, this is a budget hotel, but the front desk staff is no less professional. They were very helpful. We enjoyed our stay and extended twice. The hotel has good self-service laundry facilities. They also have a restaurant and spa facilities (YWCA) but we didn't try them. (There is free city Wifi available by the library near the basketball court -- Wifi is accessible in the room for a fee from a provider not associated with the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs!!”
Reviews.Author: shudapnow
Reviews.Content: i stayed at anne black for a night and a half last september of 08. can't quite remember which room it was. i had read an earlier review about the place possibly having bedbugs, but i ignored it since it seemed like it was written a while ago... but sure enough, while i was tossing and turning due to jetlag, i discovered several large and baby bedbugs climbing around the sheets. gross~! they even crawled into my purse which i left next to my pillow. i complained immediately and they switched me to a room on the lower floors...same problem. i squashed a few of the bugs and blood squirted onto the sheets! i should have taken the hint when i saw little brown stains on the white sheets. anyway, i checked out immediately around midnight and moved to the metropolitan right across the street. much better hotel, tho of course more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: asiatravel24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 - 4 times. For the money, I found this to be a wonderful guest house. Great staff, super service, excellent , clean, and professional. Wonderful front office staff. Nice cafe' on site. Plenty of small touches to make you feel at home. Good location. Right next to Mongkok's library for email and web things. Comfortable, safe, clean.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nuggetie
Reviews.Content: my friend lives really close to this place in hong kong so i decided to book with this ywca since it would be the easiest way to meet up with her. dont book through their actual official website it is a rip off and they don't do price matching because i found a really cheap rate for a single bedroom with shared bath room on asiarooms.com and emailed the ywca to match the price and they never emailed me back! the room was clean and was basic (which is fine i only paid $50 aus a night). they provided towels, toothpaste, toothbrush, shampoo and soap daily. they also cleaned the room daily. the shared shower was VERY clean. and althought its a shared shower i think each room has it's own mirror and sink anyway so u can brush your teeth in your room. the location is ok it's about a 10-15 minute walk to the mongkok. and finding it from the airport might be a hassle, but my friend showed me where it was so i was ok. staff spoke english and were very helpful! overall value for money

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocRadio
Reviews.Content: Hi, Me and my friend visited Hong Kong last month for our fellowship exams. We stayed in Anne Blank YWCA for six days and five nights, and i would like to share my experience about the same. It was a great time we had. In a crowded city like HK, finding a hotel with luxury at at affordable price is difficult. We found both in Anne Black. It is situated in the heart of Kowloon, accessible to important places. We had booked thru asiatravel.com and our details were already in place at the reception. We had absolutely no problem checking in, the receptionist doing all the necessary formalities. The room was a bit small, but neat and tidy with all necessary amenities, including a telephone, CTV and an AC. The room calls were answered promptly and attended to immediately. The attached restaurant provided American and Chinese food, which was pretty good and affordable too (10% discount for lodgers). Overall, at about $650 a day for twin occupancy is a a real 'VALUE FOR MONEY' hotel. I would definetly recommend the hotel to everyone who seek Luxury at an afffordable price

Reviews.Title: “Location ok..budget ok..but bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Holland77
Reviews.Content: Location...not bad...Budget ..nothing much to complain about...However, the only problem is the bed bugs. We had the unfortunate experience of having beaten by bed bugs in the hotel. However the hotel is doing routine pest control there. So its a balance of low budget..but a little risk. May not apply to all rooms..

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Fish_jumping
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong mid of July 2008. Initially I booked a hostel to save money, but found a very good deal of YWCA through an online booking site. I stayed in Ann Black for 4 nights. The location was good, but you will need to walk a little bit to get to the MTR. It's close to all the night markets, shops in Mongkok area. If you arrive in Airport, you can get to it by Airport bus A21 (again, if you are traveling light, and willing to walk a bit). There is a direct bus transport from airport (according to the hotel website) if you are willing to pay more. Given the price of the HK budget hotels, I think it was a great bargain for budget traveler. The Kowloon Library is next door. So you can check emails for free (there is computer room on the 8th floor of the Library). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. There isn't much of an atmosphere. But it's clean and it's safe. Good option for budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dtsan
Reviews.Content: We checked in June 30, 2008 and checked out July 4, 2008. Over-all, our room was satisfactory. Spacious, clean and quiet. The rest room/bathroom was spacious too and clean with toiletries. The bed is okay with me. The room was cleaned daily. The grocery, bakery and bus stops are short walking distances from the hotel. The only downside is its distance to the MTR station which is a good 10-15 minutes walk. With the temperatures and humidity when we were there, those walks were something we didn't look forward to. If you want to check your emails, go to the Kowloon Public Library just around the corner and you can use their computers with internet access for free during office hours!

Reviews.Title: “You have got to be joking!”
Reviews.Author: sassyrouge
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the reviews on here! I stayed here based on those. The room is basic, yes, but the bed is like it is made out of concrete - unsleepable on, the toilet fills up to the brim like it will overflow and the aircon is super noisy. I don't mind hostels or roughing it but this place leaves a lot to be desired - also the traffic noise is annoying. I would pay a bit extra for somewhere that has a bed that can be slept on!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile for the very budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Non-wealthy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during Chinese Lunar Year of 6 February until 8 February 2008.At first , I was very concerned on the cleanliness of the communal bathroom.However, it did not turned me down, I was very delighted that the bathrooms were very clean.The room and the facilities were all very simple.It was very satisfactory for an independent and tight budget traveller like me. The only disadvantage was that it was far away from the MTR.I had to disembark at Mongkok Station,walked along Argyle Road,turned right to Soares Street and reached upon Pui Ching Road , then finally turned left to Man Fuk Road and reached the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Lachina
Reviews.Content: My previous stay in Hong Kong on a corporate expense account was at the Intercontinental, so when I had the chance to go there on my own money and on a very tight budget, I was dismayed to find that our only affordable option was a "Y". Granted, the rooms are spartan, but we committed to a one week stay and they "upgraded" us. The rooms are clean with outdated furniture and the place could use a paint job. There is cable TV, working laundry facilities, and a restaurant that features live entertainment some nights. The place caters mainly to Chinese budget tourists and tour groups and backpackers from all over the world. The restaurant food won't knock you over, but it is okay and reasonably priced. This YWCA is located a short walk from a bus stop with all kinds of buses that will take you almost anywhere you would want to go. For other dining options, there are at least 4 bakeries at the bottom of the hill where the Y is located and the breakfast pastries are good. There is also a small, elegant French restaurant there where you can get a very good meal that won't hurt your wallet. Finally, for a good breakfast buffet, walk about 6 blocks down to the International YMCA - they offer a great buffet at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're on a budget and not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: markmat
Reviews.Content: As others have said the rooms are pretty basic, but we found them to be clean and comfortable. If you want a harbour front location then this really isn't for you (although if you go up to the higher floors you'll be able to watch the light show through the little window at the end of the corridor!). However, it is only a 10 minute brisk (or 15 minute leisurely) walk to the Ladies Market and the Mong Kok shopping area. If you go for a rate with breakfast included you will find that the selection is very limited, but if you're going out for the day you'll be constantly tempted by more food anyway! Definitely recommended if you're travelling on a bit of a budget and you want to stay somewhere a little less 'touristy'.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. Front desk staff are friendly but the restaurant/coffee shop staff, while efficient in providing service, are not so friendly compared to the front desk staff. Rooms are cleaned everyday but my wife and one of my sons had bug bites. It could probably be the comforters which may not have been changed daily.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Functional, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: quanster
Reviews.Content: First of all: any overnight stop-overs? If this is the case (which was in mine), then take the airport express to kowloon (quicker than going to central) and this hotel is a cheap, quick taxi ride to get there. The service was excellent, my room was clean and functional - I had two single beds, a small desk, an adequate shower with soap and towels. It's possible that if you're in hallway with noisy guests that the sound might carry. But honestly: it was good value and functional - and for my purposes - a quick overnight stop, wanting to stay in Kowloon, somewhere economical but clean - it was just fine. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rkkwan
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Anne Black House is probably the cheapest "real" hotel one can book in Hong Kong. It's not a hostel or a guest-house nested inside a mixed-use building. Its location isn't as bad as it sounds, as long as you're fine with using the frequent & clean buses. Two cross-harbor tunnel routes, many to Star Ferry, at least two to the New Territories. Walk to Yau Ma Tei or Mong Kok MTR in about 15 minutes. I had a single room w/shower on the top floor. Room is airy with tall ceilings. Basic facilities, single bed of the US "Twin" size. Small desk and closet, water pot provided. TV has only the 4 over-the-air channels - no cable, and no remote. No carpet, smooth fake-wood floors. No shampoo, but has slippers in sealed bags, and toothbrush/paste kit. Towels is very soft - as good as those used in 4* hotels in the US. Window-type A/C unit with heat. [Cheaper rooms have shared showers; double rooms have fridge.] Front desk staff is extremely friendly and courteous, often call me by my name. Free use of safe deposit box; also lend me a socket adapter. Phone messages taken down carefully. 5* staff. My room rate includes breakfast. 6 set breakfasts, but 2 of them require $2-4 extra. So so food, comfortable sitting. Fast service, but servers/cook like to talk loud among themselves. Excellent value, clean basic accomodations. Will definitely use again.

HotelInfo.Name: Anne Black Guest House (YWCA)
HotelInfo.Address: No.5 Man Fuk Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
